SEARCH
Package io.lyuda.jcards

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
io.lyuda.jcards.Deck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Deck>
public class Deck extends Object implements Comparable<Deck>
The Deck class represents a deck of cards. It is used to create and manage a collection of cards.

A deck of cards is created with all the possible combinations of suits and ranks, and can be shuffled and dealt from. The deck keeps track of the number of cards remaining and throws an exception if an attempt is made to deal from an empty deck.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
lyudaio

      Searches the deck for a specific card based on its rank and suit.
      Parameters:
      rank - the rank of the card to search for
      suit - the suit of the card to search for

      public Card getCardAtIndex(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Gets the card at the specified index in the deck.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the desired card
      Returns:
      the card at the specified index
      Throws:

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Deck o)
      Compares two deck of cards based on their size.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Deck>
      Parameters:
      o - the deck to compare to
      Returns:
      a negative integer if this deck has less cards than `o`, zero if this deck has the same number of cards as `o`, or a positive integer if this deck has more cards than `o`.
